The proposal that science and religion are two facets of the same reality typically argues that science and religion deal with different aspects of reality, but do not conflict with each other. In this view, science looks at the "what" and "how" of the natural world, while religion looks at the "why" and "who" of human existence and the cosmos. Religion seeks to provide a deeper understanding of the meaning and purpose of life, while science seeks to provide explanations of natural phenomena based on empirical evidence.
